GDL: A New, Simple and Powerful Clojure DSL for Writing Games with No Compromises

2023/07/23
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

GDL, a new Clojure DSL, has emerged as a powerful tool for game developers looking to write games without any compromises. The language, based on libGDX, currently supports desktop backend and 2D graphics API. GDL is gaining popularity among developers due to its simplicity and flexibility.

The author of the article highlights the ease of installation and usage of GDL. To add GDL to a project, developers simply need to include the following code in their project.clj file. The article also provides documentation and a "Hello world" window example to help developers get started with GDL.

GDL has already garnered attention from the developer community, with a growing number of stars, watchers, and forks on GitHub. The library has also received contributions from two contributors.

For game developers looking for a language that allows them to write games without compromising on performance or flexibility, GDL is a promising choice. Its integration with libGDX and support for desktop backend and 2D graphics API make it a versatile tool for game development.
